entry.et: Middle English aforthen, from Old English geforthian to carry out, from ge-, perfective prefix + forthian to carry out, from forth co-, forth

def.dt: :to manage to bear without serious detriment you can't afford to neglect your health
:to be able to bear the cost of can't afford to be out of work long
:to make available, give forth, or provide naturally or inevitably the sun affords warmth to the earth
